string.text: %c[0,245,245,220]Loners, or free stalkers, are unaligned with any of the factions that operate within the Zone.\n \nDespite being frequently harassed by mutants and other stalkers, small groups have managed to establish strong trading outposts throughout the Zone.
%c[0,245,245,220]Bandits are members of the criminal underworld who came to the Zone for different reasons; to make money by selling artefacts, to hide from the law or even to trade in weapons.

%c[0,245,245,220]Duty is a paramilitary faction at odds with everyone seeking to exploit the Zone and, as Duty sees it, spread its corruption.\n \nThey have long been in fierce conflict with Freedom due to their conflicting ideals.
%c[0,245,245,220]Freedom are anarchists and daredevils who declare themselves to be fighting for free access to the Zone and consequently find themselves in constant conflict with Duty.
%c[0,245,245,220]The Ukrainian government, through its Ministry of Internal Affairs, maintains the Zone's perimeter with internal troops from the State Security Service.
%c[0,245,245,220]The Ecologists are a government-funded body researching the Zone in order to properly harness its potential for the good of mankind.
%c[0,245,245,220]Mercenaries are experienced fighters from all walks of life who offer their services as hired soldiers, it is unknown who their clients are or why they have interests in the Zone.

%c[0,245,245,220]Monolith are a fanatical religious cult hostile to all but their own.\n \nDespite the destruction of the C-Conciousness they have since re-emerged as a resurgent force, retaking many of their former territories.

%c[0,245,245,220]Clear Sky is an independent scientific and military organisation focused on researching and understanding the Zone.\n \nFacing almost complete collapse after a failed and costly assault on Chernobyl NPP, a handful of the few remaining survivors managed to rebuild the faction to its former stature.

%c[0,245,245,220]Braaaiiinnnsss!!!\n \nZombified stalkers are mindless husks of their previous selves reduced to their most basic animal-like instincts and will attack almost anything that gets too close.

%c[0,245,245,220]Story mode starts the game with the 'Mysteries of the Zone' storyline, and with the goals to disable the Brain Scorcher and Miracle Machine.
 
Elements from previous storylines are borrowed and recreated, so this is not for players who feel that strict story continuity is essential.
 
Only available to Loner, Duty, Freedom, Ecologist, Mercenary and Clear Sky factions.
 
Not compatible with Azazel mode.

%c[0,245,245,220]Ironman mode is a feature that will remove your game saves upon death.\n \nYou are free to make as many saves as you wish but dying will result in the removal of all saves made with this character.
%c[0,245,245,220]Hardcore AI Aim is a feature that maximizes AI aim predictability, making it more difficult for the player to dodge hits while moving.
%c[0,245,245,220]Survival mode is a feature that replaces all spawns with Zombies.\n \nThese hordes will make their way to your location - be prepared! See how long you can survive!

%c[0,245,245,220]In Azazel mode, death is not the end.
 
Like the demon Azazel you will possess a new body when you die; taking over the form of another random stalker that really exists in the Zone.
 
If you have companions, you will become one of them. This feature compliments Ironman and/or Survival mode very well.
 
Not compatible with Story mode.
